intro: Pavonia kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its mountainous habitat. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are woody and often branched. Pavonia kilimandscharica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
